AlexNet Implementation (Keras)

Authors: Unknown

This document excerpt presents a Keras implementation of the AlexNet convolutional neural network architecture. It details the step-by-step construction of the model, starting with the import of necessary Keras libraries including Sequential, Convolution2D, MaxPooling2D, Flatten, Dense, Dropout, and BatchNormalization layers. The implementation begins by creating a Sequential model and then adding convolutional layers with ReLU activation functions. The first convolutional layer uses 96 filters, a kernel size of 11, stride 4, and 'valid' padding. Following this, a MaxPooling2D layer with a pool size of (2, 2) and stride 2 is added. A BatchNormalization layer is then included. The second convolutional layer utilizes 256 filters, a kernel size of 11, stride 1, and 'valid' padding. Finally, another MaxPooling2D layer with a pool size of (2, 2) and stride 2 is added. The excerpt focuses on the core building blocks of the AlexNet architecture within the Keras framework, providing a foundational example for understanding and replicating the model. The log entries at the beginning indicate potential issues with CUDA factory registration, which might require troubleshooting during the execution of the code. The document is a snippet of code and does not include the complete implementation or training details. It serves as a starting point for building an AlexNet model using Keras.
